The post Creative Ideas For Reusing Old Plastic Containers As Planters appeared first on Gardening.
item.content:encoded:
Creative Ideas For Reusing Old Plastic Containers As Planters

Plastic containers are widely used in our daily lives, but they often end up being thrown away after their initial use. However, these containers can be repurposed as planters and help reduce waste while adding a touch of greenery to your home or garden. In this article, we’ll share some creative ideas for reusing old plastic containers as planters.

1. Hanging Planters

If you have small plastic containers like yogurt cups, you can easily turn them into hanging planters. Simply punch two holes on opposite sides of the container and thread a string or wire through them. Fill the container with soil and add your favorite plant.

2. Tiered Planter Tower

You can create a tiered planter tower by stacking plastic containers of varying sizes on top of each other. Make sure to drill drainage holes in each container before stacking them together. Add soil and plants to each layer and watch your tower come to life.

3. Vertical Wall Garden

To make a vertical wall garden, cut off the top half of several large plastic bottles or containers using scissors or a knife (be careful!). Attach the bottom halves to a wooden board using screws or nails, leaving enough space between them for drainage and air circulation. Fill each container with soil and add your favorite plants.

4. Watering Can Planter

If you have an old watering can that leaks, don’t throw it away just yet! Drill small holes at the bottom of the can for drainage and fill it with soil and plants for an adorable planter that doubles as decoration.

5. Shoe Organizer Garden

An over-the-door shoe organizer can be repurposed as a vertical garden. Simply fill each pocket with soil and plant your favorite herbs or flowers. Hang the organizer on a fence or wall and enjoy your new garden.

6. Teapot Planter

If you have an old teapot that’s no longer being used, turn it into a charming planter for small plants like succulents or herbs. Fill the teapot with soil and add your plants, making sure to leave enough space for growth.

Conclusion

These are just a few creative ideas for reusing old plastic containers as planters. With a little imagination, you can turn almost any container into a beautiful planter that adds life to your home or garden while helping reduce waste in our environment.

The post Creative Ideas For Reusing Old Plastic Containers As Planters appeared first on Gardening.

item.title: Creative Ideas for Upcycling Old Pots and Containers in Your Garden

With a little creativity, you can upcycle these items and use them to add some character to your garden. Here are some ideas: 1. Turn old boots […]

The post Creative Ideas for Upcycling Old Pots and Containers in Your Garden appeared first on Gardening.
item.content:encoded:
Creative Ideas for Upcycling Old Pots and Containers in Your Garden

Do you have old pots and containers lying around the house? Don’t throw them away just yet! With a little creativity, you can upcycle these items and use them to add some character to your garden. Here are some ideas:

1. Turn old boots into planters

If you have an old pair of rain boots that are no longer being used, consider turning them into unique planters. Simply fill the boots with soil and add your favorite flowers or plants. You can place them on your front porch or along a walkway to add some color.

2. Use tea cups as mini planters

If you have mismatched tea cups lying around the house, don’t toss them out just yet! These make great mini planters for small succulents or herbs. Place them on a windowsill or create a small display on a shelf.

3. Create vertical gardens with old pallets

If you have access to old wooden pallets, consider using them to create a vertical garden. Simply attach terra cotta pots to the pallets using screws or nails, then hang the pallets vertically against a wall or fence.

4. Turn colanders into hanging baskets

If you have any old colanders that are no longer being used in the kitchen, turn them into unique hanging baskets for plants. Simply line the inside of the colander with moss or burlap fabric, then fill it with soil and add your favorite flowers.

5. Use broken terracotta pots for fairy gardens

If you’ve ever had a terracotta pot break on you, don’t toss it out just yet! Broken terracotta pots can be used to create unique fairy gardens. Simply arrange the broken pieces in a whimsical way, then add soil and miniature plants or fairy accessories.

6. Turn old tires into raised garden beds

If you have any old tires lying around, consider turning them into raised garden beds. Simply fill the tire with soil and compost, then plant your favorite vegetables or herbs.

7. Use mason jars as candle holders

If you have any old mason jars lying around, consider using them as unique candle holders for your outdoor space. Add sand or small pebbles to the bottom of the jar for stability, then place a tea light candle inside.

These are just a few ideas to get you started on upcycling old pots and containers in your garden. With a little creativity, you can turn these items into unique focal points that add character to your outdoor space.

The post Creative Ideas for Upcycling Old Pots and Containers in Your Garden appeared first on Gardening.

item.title: Creative DIY Garden Decor Ideas
item.dc:creator: Jerry Harvard
item.description:
Creative DIY Garden Decor Ideas Gardening is a great way to relax and connect with nature. Adding some creative decor ideas can make your garden even more beautiful and enjoyable. In this post, we’ll share some easy-to-follow DIY garden decor ideas that you can try out. 1. Upcycled Planters If you have some old items […]

The post Creative DIY Garden Decor Ideas appeared first on Gardening.
item.content:encoded:
Creative DIY Garden Decor Ideas

Gardening is a great way to relax and connect with nature. Adding some creative decor ideas can make your garden even more beautiful and enjoyable. In this post, we’ll share some easy-to-follow DIY garden decor ideas that you can try out.

1. Upcycled Planters

If you have some old items lying around, consider repurposing them into planters for your garden. For example, you could use an old wheelbarrow or a vintage tea set as a planter. Get creative with the items you have at home!

2. Painted Rocks

You can easily paint rocks of various sizes and colors to add visual interest to your garden. Place them in clusters or use them as markers for different plants.

3. Fairy Gardens

Fairy gardens are enchanting miniature gardens that are perfect for small spaces like patios or balconies. You can create one by adding tiny fairy figurines, small plants, and other decorative elements like stones and moss.

4. Vertical Gardens

If you have limited space in your garden, consider creating a vertical garden using pallets or hanging baskets. This allows you to grow more plants without taking up too much space on the ground.

5. Birdhouses

Birdhouses not only add charm to your garden but also attract birds that help control pests and pollinate plants. You can either buy pre-made birdhouses or build your own using recycled materials.

6. Wind Chimes

Add some soothing sounds to your garden with wind chimes made from seashells, beads, or old silverware.

7. Mosaic Stepping Stones

Create colorful stepping stones using broken tiles or glass pieces. Arrange them in patterns and designs that match your garden’s style.

8. Garden Signage

Add some personality to your garden by creating signs for different areas, like a vegetable patch or a flower bed. You can use painted wooden boards or even repurpose old license plates.

Conclusion

With these DIY ideas, you can add unique touches to your garden that reflect your personal style and creativity. Not only will they enhance the beauty of your garden, but they’ll also provide you with hours of fun and relaxation as you create them.

The post Creative DIY Garden Decor Ideas appeared first on Gardening.

item.title: Discover Creative Uses of Lavender Around the Yard
item.dc:creator: Jerry Harvard
item.description:

In this post, we’ll explore some creative ways you can use lavender around your outdoor space. Planting Lavender The first step in using lavender in your yard is planting […]

The post Discover Creative Uses of Lavender Around the Yard appeared first on Gardening.
item.content:encoded:
Discover Creative Uses of Lavender Around the Yard

Lavender is a versatile and fragrant herb that can add beauty, flavor, and even relaxation to your yard. In this post, we’ll explore some creative ways you can use lavender around your outdoor space.

Planting Lavender

The first step in using lavender in your yard is planting it. Lavender plants thrive in well-draining soil with plenty of sunlight. They also prefer slightly alkaline soil with a pH between 6.5 and 7.5, so consider adding lime or wood ash to your soil if necessary.

Lavender can be planted in garden beds, as edging for pathways or borders, or even in containers on patios or balconies. Be sure to give each plant enough space to grow; most varieties will spread up to three feet wide.

Attracting Pollinators

Lavender’s delicate purple flowers are not only beautiful but also attract pollinators like bees and butterflies to your yard. Planting lavender near other flowering plants can help increase their pollination rates as well.

In addition to attracting pollinators, the fragrance of lavender can also repel mosquitoes and other pests from your yard.

Making Lavender Crafts

Lavender’s fragrant blooms make it a popular choice for crafting projects around the home. One simple way to use lavender is by creating sachets filled with dried flowers that can be placed in drawers or closets for a fresh scent.

You can also make homemade soap or candles infused with lavender oil for a spa-like experience at home. Another creative idea is to create wreaths or garlands made from fresh lavender that adds natural beauty and fragrance throughout the year.

Cooking with Lavender

Lavender is a versatile herb that can be used in cooking to add a unique flavor and aroma to dishes. The flowers are often used to flavor desserts like cakes, ice cream, or even shortbread cookies.

You can also use lavender in savory dishes like roasted chicken or lamb for a subtle floral note. Just be sure to use it sparingly as it can quickly overpower other flavors.

Relaxing with Lavender

The fragrance of lavender has been shown to have relaxing effects on the body and mind. You can create a calming atmosphere in your yard by planting lavender near seating areas or creating an outdoor meditation space surrounded by this beautiful herb.

You could also create homemade bath salts using dried lavender flowers and Epsom salt for a soothing soak after a long day outside.

Conclusion

In conclusion, there are many creative uses of lavender around the yard. From attracting pollinators and repelling pests to making crafts and cooking, this fragrant herb is truly versatile. Consider adding some lavender plants to your yard today!

The post Discover Creative Uses of Lavender Around the Yard appeared first on Gardening.

item.title: 10 Creative Ways to Repurpose Old Gardening Tools
item.dc:creator: Jerry Harvard
item.description:
10 Creative Ways to Repurpose Old Gardening Tools Gardening tools are essential for any gardener, but over time they can become worn out or broken. Instead of throwing them away, why not repurpose them into something new and useful? Here are 10 creative ways to repurpose old gardening tools: 1. Garden Tool Rack Create a […]

The post 10 Creative Ways to Repurpose Old Gardening Tools appeared first on Gardening.
item.content:encoded:
10 Creative Ways to Repurpose Old Gardening Tools

Gardening tools are essential for any gardener, but over time they can become worn out or broken. Instead of throwing them away, why not repurpose them into something new and useful? Here are 10 creative ways to repurpose old gardening tools:

1. Garden Tool Rack

Create a garden tool rack by attaching your old gardening tools to a piece of wood or metal. Hang the rack in your shed or garage for easy access to your gardening essentials.

2. Birdhouse

Taking an old watering can and creating it into a birdhouse is a fun way to add some personality to your garden while also providing shelter for birds.

3. Planter

An old wheelbarrow or shovel can make an interesting planter for flowers, herbs or succulents.

4. Wind Chimes

Create beautiful wind chimes using old forks, spoons, and other metal pieces from your gardening tools collection.

5. Garden Art Sculptures

Bend and shape your old shovels and rakes into interesting sculptures that will add charm to any outdoor space.

6. Hose Holder

Hang an old rake on the wall as a holder for your garden hose so you always know where it is when you need it.

7. Trellis

An old ladder can be transformed into the perfect trellis for climbing plants like cucumbers, beans or tomatoes.

8. Plant Markers

Create unique plant markers using cutlery handles or other metal pieces from your old gardening tools.

9. Garden Fence

Bend and attach old wire fencing to a trellis or post to create a rustic garden fence that will keep animals out of your plants.

10. Garden Bench

Create a cozy outdoor space by repurposing an old wheelbarrow, wooden crate or other gardening tools into a comfortable bench for seating.

There are endless possibilities when it comes to repurposing old gardening tools. Get creative and see what you can come up with!

The post 10 Creative Ways to Repurpose Old Gardening Tools appeared first on Gardening.

item.title: Creative Ways to Use Plants in Home Decor
item.dc:creator: Jerry Harvard
item.description:
Creative Ways to Use Plants in Home Decor Plants are an excellent addition to any home decor. Not only do they add a touch of nature, but they also help purify the air and bring a sense of calmness to your surroundings. Here are some creative ways to incorporate plants into your home decor: 1. […]

The post Creative Ways to Use Plants in Home Decor appeared first on Gardening.
item.content:encoded:
Creative Ways to Use Plants in Home Decor

Plants are an excellent addition to any home decor. Not only do they add a touch of nature, but they also help purify the air and bring a sense of calmness to your surroundings. Here are some creative ways to incorporate plants into your home decor:

1. Hanging Plants

Hanging plants are an excellent way to add greenery and interest to any room. They can be hung from the ceiling or placed on a high shelf for added height and visual appeal.

2. Terrariums

Terrariums are miniature gardens enclosed in glass containers that can be displayed on tables, shelves, or even hung from the ceiling. They come in various sizes and shapes, making them perfect for any space.

3. Vertical Gardens

A vertical garden is a great way to add greenery to small spaces like apartment balconies or patios. You can create one by hanging planters on a wall or using a pre-made system like a living wall.

4. Herb Garden

An herb garden not only adds greenery but also provides fresh herbs for cooking. You can create one indoors by placing pots on a windowsill or using a hydroponic system for no-mess gardening.

5. Potted Trees

If you have high ceilings, consider adding potted trees like fiddle leaf figs or rubber trees for added drama and height.

6. Wreaths

You don’t have to limit the use of plants indoors only! Consider adding wreaths made out of dried flowers, eucalyptus leaves, or other seasonal foliage as part of your outdoor decor.

7. Plant Stands

If you have a collection of plants, consider using plant stands to create a display. They come in various sizes and materials like wood or metal and can be customized to fit any decor style.

8. Moss Walls

A moss wall is a unique way to add greenery to your home while creating a statement piece. It’s made by attaching live moss to a vertical surface like a wall or paneling and requires minimal maintenance.

In conclusion, adding plants to your home decor is an easy way to bring nature indoors while improving the air quality and creating visual interest. With these creative ideas, you can transform any space into an oasis of greenery!

The post Creative Ways to Use Plants in Home Decor appeared first on Gardening.
